trans: 欧内斯特.沙克尔顿爵士

sentences.english: It includes sites on every continent, among them Sir Ernest Shackleton's 1908 expedition hut in Antarctica and Australia's Dampier Rock art complex, which dates from 8000BC.
sentences.chinese: 名单涵盖了各大洲的古迹，包括欧内斯特，沙克尔顿爵士1908年远征南极洲时住的小屋、始于公元前8000年前的澳大利亚丹皮尔地区的岩画群。

sentences.chinese: 他向他们笑了笑表示谢意。

sentences.chinese: …一个发起运动反对体罚儿童的组织。

sentences.chinese: 卢克紧紧抓着她的胳膊，领她进了门。

detailed_translations.english: to take and hold something firmly
the way you hold something or your ability to hold it

sentences.english: ...natural gas, which gives off less carbon dioxide than coal.
sentences.chinese: …天然气的二氧化碳排放量少于煤。

detailed_translations.english: If something gives off or gives out a gas, heat, or a smell, it produces it and sends it out into the air

name: Lionel Greenstreet
trans: 莱昂内尔.格林斯特里特

detailed_translations.chinese: 莱昂内尔.格林斯特里特

sentences.english: He was easily bored.
sentences.chinese: 他很容易感到厌烦。

sentences.english: After a while, I got bored and left.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，我觉得无聊，就走了。

detailed_translations.english: tired and impatient because you do not think something is interesting, or because you have nothing to do

sentences.english: Three weeks ago, it was discovered the cancer had spread to his liver.
sentences.chinese: 三周前，发现癌已扩散到了他的肝脏。

detailed_translations.english: a large organ in your body that produces bile and cleans your blood

sentences.english: a master chef
sentences.chinese: 手艺高超的厨师长

sentences.english: a pastry chef
sentences.chinese: 糕饼师傅

detailed_translations.english: a skilled cook, especially the main cook in a hotel or restaurant

sentences.english: changeable weather
sentences.chinese: 变化无常的天气

detailed_translations.chinese: 无常的；可改变的；易变的；不定的
detailed_translations.english: likely to change, or changing often

sentences.english: The physician must exercise caution when prescribing antidepressants.
sentences.chinese: 医师在开抗抑郁药处方时必须谨慎。

sentences.english: Business leaders are cautioning against hasty action that would hamper flexibility.
sentences.chinese: 企业领导人被告诫不要贸然采取行动，以免把事情搞僵。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being very careful to avoid danger or risks
to warn someone that something might be dangerous, difficult etc

name: sun-blindness
trans: 日盲症，（因阳光强烈导致的暂时）失明

detailed_translations.chinese: 日盲症，（因阳光强烈导致的暂时）失明

name: admirable
trans: 令人钦佩的，绝妙的，极好的

sentences.english: an admirable achievement
sentences.chinese: 令人钦佩的成就

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人钦佩的；极好的；值得赞扬的
detailed_translations.english: having many good qualities that you respect and admire

name: commitment
trans: 许诺，委托事项，承担义务

sentences.english: Are you ready to make a long-term commitment ?
sentences.chinese: 你是否准备好作出长久的承诺？

detailed_translations.english: a promise to do something or to behave in a particular way

sentences.english: An old Arab proverb says, "The enemy of my enemy is my friend."
sentences.chinese: 有一句古老的阿拉伯谚语说：“我敌人的敌人是我的朋友。”

detailed_translations.english: a short well-known statement that gives advice or expresses something that is generally true. ‘A penny saved is a penny earned’ is an example of a proverb.

sentences.english: Land rose from its womb, usurped its throne, and ever since the maddened old creature, with hoary crest of foam, wails and laments continually, like King Lear exposed to the fury of the elements.
sentences.chinese: 大地从它的腹中隆起，篡夺了它的王位。 从那以后，暴怒的老家伙就开始顶着灰白色的泡沫不断的哀号恸哭，一如暴风骤雨之中的李尔王。

sentences.english: The original ending of King Lear wasn’t performed for nearly 150 years because it was thought too upsetting.
sentences.chinese: 《李尔王》的原始结尾在长达150年的时间里没有上演过，因为人们认为它太悲伤了。

sentences.english: They listened in respectful silence.
sentences.chinese: 他们毕恭毕敬地静听。

detailed_translations.english: feeling or showing respect

sentences.english: ...accusations that he had been disrespectful to a police officer.
sentences.chinese: ...关于他曾对一名警官无礼的控告。

detailed_translations.english: If you are disrespectful, you show no respect in the way that you speak or behave to someone

sentences.english: It jumped up and down disrespectfully, mocking the hunting soldiers. It threw a nut at them.
sentences.chinese: 它无礼地上窜下跳，戏弄士兵们，还朝他们扔果核。

sentences.english: They  bowed before the emperor as he entered the court.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝进入朝廷时他们都向他鞠躬致敬。

sentences.english: The daughter of an emperor does not worry about finding a husband.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝女儿不愁嫁。

sentences.english: The old chancellor who had offended against the emperor was relegated to the distant boundaries of the country.
sentences.chinese: 触犯了皇帝的老宰相被流放到遥远的边疆。

detailed_translations.english: the man who is the ruler of an empire

sentences.english: The days are shortening.
sentences.chinese: 白天变得越来越短了。

detailed_translations.english: to become shorter or make something shorter

sentences.english: They need more funds to modernize the country’s telephone system.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要更多的资金将本国的电话系统现代化。

sentences.english: a tastefully modernized old farmhouse
sentences.chinese: 雅致而现代化的旧农舍

detailed_translations.english: to make something such as a system or building more modern

sentences.english: He is next in line to the throne (= will become king when the present ruler dies ) .
sentences.chinese: 他是第一王位继承人。

sentences.english: In 1913, George V was on the throne (= was ruling ) .
sentences.chinese: 1913年乔治五世在位。

detailed_translations.english: the position and power of being a king or queen

sentences.english: She also says that on one occasion, Regan hung up on her in the middle of a phone conversation.
sentences.chinese: 她还表示，有一次，在电话交谈中，里根挂了她的电话。

sentences.english: This part is equal in value to what I give to Goneril.
sentences.chinese: 这部份和我给贡纳莉的那部份价值相等。

sentences.english: Don't grudge Anne Cordelia her fancies, Diana. I'm always sorry for children who don't spend a few years in fairyland.
sentences.chinese: 不要对安妮.科迪莉亚的想象力不满，戴安娜，我总是为没有在童话世界中度过一段岁月的孩子感到遗憾。

sentences.english: the Duke of Edinburgh
sentences.chinese: 爱丁堡公爵

detailed_translations.english: a nobleman of the highest rank

sentences.english: One of my students from Albany, NY was suffering from bouts of severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 我一个来自纽约奥尔巴尼的学生曾患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: Prince Charles leads an expensive life and the Duchy of Cornwall is there to fund it.
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯王子过着一种奢侈的生活，这些都由康沃尔公国进行资助。

sentences.english: But the move to abolish shared berths for rail passengers travelling alone from London to Cornwall shows that, like Greta Garbo, we all now want to be alone.
sentences.chinese: 但废除从伦敦到康沃尔的单身旅行者共用铺位的运动却表明，如同葛丽泰·嘉宝那样，现在的我们希望独处。

sentences.english: The most extraordinary safari I ever organised for Abercrombie and Kent was in 1993 when I took Bill and Melinda Gates round East Africa.
sentences.chinese: 我为阿伯克龙比和肯特组织的最特别的猎游是1993年的时候，当时我带比尔盖茨夫妇去东非。

sentences.english: His family responsibilities had started to become a burden.
sentences.chinese: 家庭责任已开始成为他的负担。

detailed_translations.english: something difficult or worrying that you are responsible for

sentences.english: I wouldn't dare hand this project over to anyone else.
sentences.chinese: 我可不敢将这个项目交给其他任何人负责。

detailed_translations.english: If you hand something over to someone, you give them the responsibility for dealing with a particular situation or problem

sentences.english: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 凯利获得提升，这意味着钱多了，责任也更大了。

detailed_translations.english: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

sentences.english: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.english: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.chinese: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.english: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.chinese: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。

sentences.english: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.chinese: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.english: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.english: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

sentences.english: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
sentences.chinese: 邻国之间的边界争端

detailed_translations.english: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

sentences.english: Tickets are limited and will be allocated to those who apply first.
sentences.chinese: 票数有限，将分配给那些先申请的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分配； 分派， 把…拨给
detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose, give something to a particular person etc, especially after an official decision has been made

sentences.english: Letting taxes rise abruptly would hurt not only the recovery but also whichever party the electorate ended up blaming.
sentences.chinese: 突然的增税不但会妨害经济复苏，而且无论哪个政党这样做都会受到选民指责。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无论哪个， 无论哪些

sentences.english: Look, darling, there’s Mary.
sentences.chinese: 看呀，亲爱的，玛丽来了。

sentences.english: my two darling daughters
sentences.chinese: 我那两个宝贝女儿

detailed_translations.english: used when speaking to someone you love
used of someone you love very much

sentences.english: Betty adores her grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂非常宠爱孙辈。

detailed_translations.english: to love someone very much and feel very proud of them

sentences.english: They went to the mosque to pray.
sentences.chinese: 他们去清真寺祷告。

detailed_translations.english: to speak to God in order to ask for help or give thanks

sentences.english: She moved back home to care for her elderly parents.
sentences.chinese: 她搬回家住，好照料年迈的双亲。

detailed_translations.english: to look after sb who is sick, very old, very young, etc

sentences.english: the sheer majesty of St Peter's in Rome
sentences.chinese: 罗马圣彼得大教堂的雄伟庄严

sentences.english: His Majesty the King
sentences.chinese: 国王陛下

detailed_translations.english: the impressive and attractive quality that sth has

name: lord
trans: 封建领主，地主，统治者；（宗）上帝

sentences.english: the feudal lords
sentences.chinese: 封建领主

detailed_translations.english: a man in  medieval  Europe who was very powerful and owned a lot of land
a man in  medieval  Europe who was very powerful and owned a lot of land

sentences.english: Take me for thy bridegroom, for I love thee.
sentences.chinese: 让我作你的新郎吧。 因为我爱你。

sentences.english: Many gifts were showered on the bride and bridegroom.
sentences.chinese: 人们纷纷给新娘和新郎送贺礼。

sentences.english: At the wedding party， the bride and the bridegroom expressed that they would live in harmony and mutual respect and grow old together.
sentences.chinese: 婚礼上， 新娘和新郎表示要互敬互爱，白头偕老。

detailed_translations.english: a man at the time he gets married, or just after he is married

sentences.english: a man distributing leaflets to passers-by
sentences.chinese: 一个向路人派发传单的男子

sentences.english: Make sure that your weight is evenly distributed.
sentences.chinese: 注意让你的重量分布均匀。

detailed_translations.english: to share things among a group of people, especially in a planned way

name: troop
trans: (pl)军队；英文释义：〔集结在一起活动的〕一群人[动物]

sentences.english: Both countries agreed to withdraw their troops .
sentences.chinese: 两国都同意撤军。

sentences.english: troops stationed in Hawaii
sentences.chinese: 夏威夷的驻军

detailed_translations.english: soldiers in an organized group
if a group of people troop somewhere, they walk there together in a way that shows they are tired or bored

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

sentences.english: Perhaps, when you've heard me out, you'll appreciate the reason for secrecy.
sentences.chinese: 也许当你听我把话讲完后，你就会明白为什么要保密了。

detailed_translations.english: to listen until sb has finished saying what they want to say

sentences.english: He spoke on behalf of all the members of the faculty and staff.
sentences.chinese: 他代表全体教职员工讲了话。

sentences.english: There is one database heap per database, and the database manager uses it on behalf of all applications connected to the database.
sentences.chinese: 每个数据库都有一个数据库堆，数据库管理器使用它来代表连接到数据库上的所有应用程序。

detailed_translations.english: as the representative of sb or instead of them

sentences.english: He is ambitious and susceptible to flattery.
sentences.chinese: 他雄心勃勃，而且很喜欢听恭维话。

detailed_translations.english: praise that you do not really mean

sentences.english: Perry would always flatter Mrs. Mitchell by praising her cooking.
sentences.chinese: 佩里常常奉承米切尔太太，称赞她的烹调手艺。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone in order to please them or get something from them, even though you do not mean it

sentences.english: "As I'm sure you can understand, " she started off with one of the first applicants, "in a business like this, our personal integrity must be beyond question." She leaned forward.
sentences.chinese: “我相信您一定能理解，” 她对第一个申请者说，“做我们这种生意的，个人信誉必须是毫无疑问的。”

sentences.english: As tempers rose, he spoke out strongly against some of the radical ideas for selling off state-owned property.
sentences.chinese: 随着火气上升，他公开表达了对某些卖掉国有资产的过激想法的强烈反对。

detailed_translations.english: If you speak out against something or in favour of something, you say publicly that you think it is bad or good.

sentences.english: Check your rope frequently, as friction against the rock can wear it away.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查绳索，因为与岩石摩擦会使它磨损。

detailed_translations.english: when one surface rubs against another

sentences.english: The weather forecast is good for tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报说明天是晴天。

sentences.english: Rain was forecast for the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 预报周末有雨。

detailed_translations.english: a description of what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now
to make a statement saying what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now

sentences.english: Congress is continuing to oppose the President’s health care budget.
sentences.chinese: 国会继续反对总统的医疗保健预算。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

sentences.english: Are you packing up already? It's only 4 o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 你已经开始打点行李了？现在才刚刚4点钟。

detailed_translations.english: to put your possessions into a bag, etc. before leaving a place

sentences.english: Lille is close to the frontier between France and Belgium.
sentences.chinese: 里尔靠近法比边境。

detailed_translations.english: the border of a country

sentences.english: He was giving his collection away for free.
sentences.chinese: 他正在无偿捐赠他的收藏。

sentences.english: She would give nothing away.
sentences.chinese: 她什么也不会泄露。

detailed_translations.english: If you give away something that you own, you give it to someone, rather than selling it, often because you no longer want it.

name: fond
trans: 喜爱的；慈爱的，宠爱的，溺爱的

sentences.english: I am very fond of Michael.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢迈克尔。

detailed_translations.english: feeling affection for sb, especially sb you have known for a long time

sentences.english: President Bush used to be fond of saying that American troops would stay in Iraq as long as needed and not a day longer.
sentences.chinese: 布什总统以往喜欢说只要有需要美军会驻留在伊拉克，但也不会多留一天。

sentences.english: For another, people seem to be fond of boasting off how they abide by traditions through holding grand funerals for their parents.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，人们似乎非常喜欢通过为父母举办豪华的葬礼来显示他们有多么遵守传统。

sentences.english: The experiment also revealed  introverted men to be fond of yellow and neurotic women to be keen on grey.
sentences.chinese: 实验还揭示出，内向男子更喜欢黄色，而有焦虑症状的女子热衷灰色。

sentences.english: His manner was sly and deceitful.
sentences.chinese: 他的态度诡诈而又不老实。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺骗的；欺诈的；谎言的；虚伪的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is deceitful tells lies in order to get what they want

sentences.english: Young prisoners are being corrupted by the older, long-term offenders.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的囚犯正在被年纪较大、刑期长的犯人带坏。

sentences.english: Corrupt judges have taken millions of dollars in bribes.
sentences.chinese: 腐败的法官接受了几百万美元的贿赂。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone to start behaving in an immoral or dishonest way
using your power in a dishonest or illegal way in order to get an advantage for yourself

sentences.english: a greedy and selfish society
sentences.chinese: 一个贪婪自私的社会

sentences.english: He looked at the gold with greedy eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他贪婪地看着这些金子。

sentences.english: Have you eaten them all, you greedy pig?
sentences.chinese: 你把那些全吃了？你这贪吃的猪！

detailed_translations.english: always wanting more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

sentences.english: people motivated by jealousy and greed
sentences.chinese: 受妒忌和贪婪驱使的人们

detailed_translations.english: a strong desire for more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

sentences.english: Nobody would believe that I was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 没人肯相信我是清白的。

sentences.english: The court found him innocent and he was released.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判他无罪，他被释放了。

sentences.english: She had always regarded Greg as a hopeless innocent where women were concerned.
sentences.chinese: 她过去一直认为格雷格在关于女人方面是一个不可救药的无知者。

detailed_translations.english: not guilty of a crime
An innocent is someone who is innocent

sentences.english: a cunning opponent
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的对手

detailed_translations.english: someone who is cunning is clever and good at deceiving people in order to get what they want
the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

sentences.english: the storage of highly radioactive material
sentences.chinese: 高放射性材料的存放

detailed_translations.english: the process of keeping or putting something in a special place while it is not being used

sentences.english: Nothomb is a Belgian author.
sentences.chinese: 诺东是位比利时作家。

sentences.english: It’s clear that the author is a woman.
sentences.chinese: 显然，这位作者是女性。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has written a book

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

name: Stratford-on-Avon
trans: 埃文河畔斯特拉特福镇（莎翁故乡）

detailed_translations.chinese: 埃文河畔斯特拉特福镇（莎翁故乡）

sentences.english: He is well grounded in Latin.
sentences.chinese: 他拉丁语的功底很扎实。

sentences.english: I must brush up on my Latin.
sentences.chinese: 我必须把拉丁语重温一下。

sentences.english: This word comes from Latin.
sentences.chinese: 这个词源于拉丁语。

detailed_translations.english: the language used in ancient Rome

sentences.english: Focus on those big tasks, that will make a name for you, that will generate long-term income, that will give you lasting satisfaction and happiness.
sentences.chinese: 把精力放在那些重要任务上，它们将使你成名，带来长时间的回报和长时间的幸福与满足。

sentences.english: Unless they come from wealthy families, they have to win lots of competitions, quickly make a name and hope that someone will lend them a great instrument.
sentences.chinese: 除非他们来自富有的家庭，或者赢得众多比赛奖项迅速成名以此希望有人能借给他们一副质地精良的乐器。

sentences.english: Maybe he’s just trying to make a name for himself.
sentences.chinese: 也许他只是想为自己博得一些名声和人气。

sentences.english: an allergic reaction to nuts
sentences.chinese: 对坚果的过敏性反应

detailed_translations.english: having an allergy

sentences.english: She started coughing and sneezing.
sentences.chinese: 她开始咳嗽、打喷嚏。

sentences.english: The dust was making him sneeze .
sentences.chinese: 灰尘使他打起了喷嚏。

detailed_translations.english: if you sneeze, air suddenly comes from your nose, making a noise, for example when you have a cold
the act or sound of sneezing

sentences.english: She was sitting in an armchair with blankets wrapped around her.
sentences.chinese: 她当时正裹着毯子坐在一把扶手椅里。

detailed_translations.english: a comfortable chair with sides that you can rest your arms on

sentences.english: New evidence has confirmed the first witness’s story.
sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.english: To confirm my diagnosis I need to do some tests.
sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

detailed_translations.english: to state or show that sth is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence

sentences.english: You first must create the buffer, fill it, then rewind the position to the beginning so you can read from the start.
sentences.chinese: 必须首先创建一个缓冲区，先填充它，然后将位置倒回起始点，这样才能从头读。

detailed_translations.english: to make a  cassette  tape or  video  go backwards in order to see or hear it again

sentences.english: Cash was taken during a burglary of the apartment.
sentences.chinese: 在一次公寓盗窃案中现金被盗。

sentences.english: There are similar charges if you want to cash a cheque or withdraw money at a branch other than your own.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在其他银行兑现支票或支取现金，将会产生差不多的手续费。

detailed_translations.english: money in the form of coins or notes rather than cheques,  credit card s  etc
If you cash a cheque, you exchange it at a bank for the amount of money that it is worth

sentences.english: You could write her a cheque .
sentences.chinese: 你可以给她开张支票。

detailed_translations.english: a printed piece of paper that you write an amount of money on, sign, and use instead of money to pay for things

sentences.english: Her signature is totally illegible (= cannot be read ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的签字完全无法辨认。

sentences.english: The school collected 4,000 signatures for the petition.
sentences.chinese: 学校为这份请愿书收集到了四千个签名。

sentences.english: The Ukrainians put their signatures to the Lisbon Protocol.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰签署了《里斯本协议》。

sentences.english: Someone’s forged my signature (= made an illegal copy of my name to deceive people ) on this letter.
sentences.chinese: 有人在这封信中伪造了我的签名。

sentences.english: Each child must obtain the signature of his or her parents.
sentences.chinese: 每个小孩都必须得到父母的签字。

detailed_translations.english: your name written in the way you usually write it, for example at the end of a letter, or on a cheque etc, to show that you have written it

sentences.english: a terminal branch of a tree
sentences.chinese: 树顶枝条

sentences.english: terminal examinations (= at the end of a course, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 期终考试

sentences.english: the airport’s passenger terminal
sentences.chinese: 机场航站楼

detailed_translations.english: at the end of sth

detailed_translations.english: a big building where people wait to get onto planes, buses, or ships, or where goods are loaded

sentences.english: Only a few apartments were still vacant.
sentences.chinese: 只有几套公寓仍然空着。

sentences.english: There was only a vacant lot (= empty unused area of land in a city ) where her house used to be.
sentences.chinese: 她以前房子所在的地方只剩下一块空地了。

detailed_translations.english: a vacant seat, building, room or piece of land is empty and available for someone to use

name: dusty
trans: 满是灰尘的，积满灰尘的

sentences.english: Adrian cycled along the dusty road.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安沿着满是尘土的路骑自行车。

sentences.english: Everything’s really dusty.
sentences.chinese: 所有东西都布满灰尘。

detailed_translations.english: covered with dust

sentences.english: ...a bottle of white burgundy.
sentences.chinese: ...一瓶勃艮第白葡萄酒。

detailed_translations.english: Burgundy is a type of wine. It can be white or red in colour and comes from the region of France called Burgundy.

sentences.english: They are likely to respond positively to the president's request for aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们有可能积极地回应该总统的援助请求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回答， 答复； 作出反应， 响应
detailed_translations.english: to do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done

sentences.english: But Oswald stressed that the research looked at the average person, and could not account for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 不过奥斯瓦德强调研究只是针对普通大众，不见得适用于所有人。

sentences.english: "We find a very strong link between cash falling on you and higher contentment and better mental health in the following year," said Oswald.
sentences.chinese: “我们发现意外的财产收入与之后一年内较高的满足感以及更好的精神状况有十分密切的联系，”奥斯瓦德说。

sentences.english: The staff were very good.
sentences.chinese: 员工们都很棒。

sentences.english: 10 staff were allocated to the task.
sentences.chinese: 10名员工被分派做这项任务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全体职员，员工；工作人员；参谋
detailed_translations.english: the people who work for an organization

sentences.english: On June 5, 1976, Needham delivered his last sermon as Master of Caius College. I quote from that sermon.
sentences.chinese: 1976年6月5日，李约瑟作为剑桥大学凯斯学院的院长进行了他最后一次说教或演讲，下边就是他的讲话的引用。

sentences.english: She strongly suspected he was lying to her.
sentences.chinese: 她非常怀疑他在对她撒谎。

sentences.english: She’s not going to be very happy about this, I suspect .
sentences.chinese: 我想对于此事她不会太高兴。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, especially something bad
someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime

sentences.english: Nobody insults my family and gets away with it!
sentences.chinese: 谁也别想侮辱了我的家人之后就这么算了！

sentences.english: I hope Andy won’t be insulted if I don’t come.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不来，希望安迪不要介意。

sentences.english: 200 for all that work? It’s an insult.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：干那么多工作才给200美元？这简直是侮辱。

detailed_translations.english: to offend someone by saying or doing something they think is rude
a remark or action that is offensive or deliberately rude

sentences.english: Do not scold the puppy, but simply and firmly say ‘no’.
sentences.chinese: 不要责骂小狗，但要干脆利落地说“不”。

detailed_translations.english: to angrily criticize someone, especially a child, about something they have done

sentences.english: He was a drunken bully.
sentences.chinese: 他是个喝醉酒的恶霸。

sentences.english: She was lying in a drunken stupor (= nearly unconscious from being drunk ) on the sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 她醉得神志不清，躺在人行道上。

detailed_translations.english: drunk or showing that you are drunk

sentences.english: John yawned and scratched his leg.
sentences.chinese: 约翰打了个呵欠，挠了挠腿。

sentences.english: Try not to scratch.
sentences.chinese: 尽量别挠。

detailed_translations.english: to rub your skin with your nails because it feels uncomfortable

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓痕， 划痕； 抓， 搔， 刮
detailed_translations.english: a small cut on someone’s skin

sentences.english: Check your baggage in at the desk.
sentences.chinese: 在服务台托运行李。

detailed_translations.english: the cases, bags, boxes etc carried by someone who is travelling

sentences.english: Angry demonstrators demanded the resignation of two senior officials.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的示威者要求两名高级官员辞职。

sentences.english: ‘Where are you going?’ she demanded angrily.
sentences.chinese: “你要去哪里？” 她气愤地质问道。

detailed_translations.english: to ask for something very firmly, especially because you think you have a right to do this
the need or desire that people have for particular goods and services

sentences.english: Anna looks after costumes and props.
sentences.chinese: 安娜管理服装和道具。

detailed_translations.chinese: 支柱，支撑物；支持者；道具；（橄榄球中的）支柱前锋
detailed_translations.english: an object placed under or against something to hold it in a particular position

detailed_translations.chinese: 支撑，支持，维持；使倚靠在某物上
detailed_translations.english: to support something by leaning it against something, or by putting something else under, next to, or behind it

sentences.english: They were married in a civil ceremony in May.
sentences.chinese: 他们在五月份举行了世俗婚礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the people who live in a country

sentences.english: A trolleybus will take you to the museum .
sentences.chinese: 一部无轨电车会带你到博物馆。

sentences.english: The new trolleybus line was routed through the commercial district.
sentences.chinese: 新的无轨电车路线规定要通过商业区。

sentences.english: When in Pyongyang, Jong Tae-se, a Japanese-born forward who plays for the J-League team Kawasaki Frontale, travels to training by subway and trolleybus .
sentences.chinese: 出生于日本、在日本J联赛中效力于川崎前锋队的前锋郑大世，在平壤时乘坐地铁和无轨电车去训练。

detailed_translations.english: a bus that uses power from electric wires above the street

sentences.english: Have you signed the hotel register ?
sentences.chinese: 你在酒店登记簿上签名了吗？

sentences.english: Police want a national register of DNA samples.
sentences.chinese: 警方想要一个全国范围的DNA样本登记册。

sentences.english: How many students have registered for English classes?
sentences.chinese: 有多少学生注册选修英语课了？

detailed_translations.english: an official list of names of people, companies etc, or a book that has this list
to put someone’s or something’s name on an official list

sentences.chinese: 今天是美国的马丁.路德.金纪念日。

sentences.english: For this day, we celebrate Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s return to the National Mall.
sentences.chinese: 在这一天，我们欢庆马丁·路德·金博士重返国家大草坪。

sentences.english: We boycott all products tested on animals.
sentences.chinese: 我们抵制所有拿动物做试验的产品。

sentences.english: They are now trying to organize a boycott.
sentences.chinese: 他们正试图组织一场抵制行动。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to buy something, use something, or take part in something as a way of protesting
an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted

sentences.english: Smoking is strictly prohibited inside the factory.
sentences.chinese: 厂区严禁吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that an action is illegal or not allowed

sentences.english: His solicitor said he committed the offence because he was heavily in debt.
sentences.chinese: 他的律师说他犯罪是因为欠下巨债。

detailed_translations.english: an illegal action or a crime

sentences.english: unjust laws
sentences.chinese: 不公正的法律

detailed_translations.chinese: 不公平的，不公正的；非正义的
detailed_translations.english: not fair or reasonable

sentences.english: the separation of church and state
sentences.chinese: 政教分离

detailed_translations.chinese: 分离，分开；间隔，距离；[法] 分居；缺口
detailed_translations.english: when something separates or is separate

sentences.english: the traditions of South East Asia
sentences.chinese: 东南亚的传统

sentences.english: the tradition that the eldest son inherits the property
sentences.chinese: 长子继承家产的传统

sentences.english: By tradition, it’s the bride’s parents who pay for the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 根据传统习俗，婚礼的费用由新娘的父母承担。

detailed_translations.english: a belief, custom, or way of doing something that has existed for a long time, or these beliefs, customs etc in general

sentences.english: In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，琼斯夫人不得已接受了一次她右膝的手术以减轻疼痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议
detailed_translations.english: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

sentences.english: an unwilling helper
sentences.chinese: 勉强来帮忙的人

detailed_translations.english: not wanting to do something and refusing to do it

sentences.english: Suddenly he seized my hand.
sentences.chinese: 他突然抓住我的手。

sentences.english: The rebels have seized power.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子夺取了政权。

sentences.english: The gunmen were seized at 1 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 这几名持枪歹徒在凌晨1点被抓获。

detailed_translations.english: to take hold of something suddenly and violently

sentences.english: Newspapers seized on the results as proof that global warming wasn't really happening.
sentences.chinese: 报纸用这些结果作为全球变暖并未真正发生的证据

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly show a lot of interest in sth, especially because you can use it to your advantage

sentences.chinese: 218号公路上有两辆汽车迎面相撞，两人死亡。

sentences.chinese: 两国为捕鱼权而发生的冲突

detailed_translations.english: an accident in which two or more people or vehicles hit each other while moving in different directions

sentences.english: The two communities are now on a collision course.
sentences.chinese: 这两个社区现在处于可能发生冲突的状态。

detailed_translations.english: If two or more people or things are on a collision course, there is likely to be a sudden and violent disagreement between them

sentences.english: Things might get better, but it doesn’t look very hopeful right now.
sentences.chinese: 情况也许会好转，但目前看来希望不大。

detailed_translations.english: making you believe that sth you want will happen; bringing hope

sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

sentences.chinese: 这个国家陷入了经济大混乱。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which everything is happening in a confused way and nothing is organized or arranged in order

sentences.chinese: 朱莉接下来的计划包括《新埃及艳后》和《塞丽娜》两部电影，后一部讲述的是一个女人试图杀死继子的故事。

sentences.english: a pair of sandals
sentences.chinese: 一双凉鞋

detailed_translations.english: a light shoe that is fastened onto your foot by bands of leather or cloth, and is worn in warm weather

sentences.english: She’s always very punctual for appointments.
sentences.chinese: 她一向准时赴约。

sentences.english: the punctual payment of invoices
sentences.chinese: 准时结清费用清单

detailed_translations.english: arriving, happening, or being done at exactly the time that has been arranged

sentences.english: ‘I’m going to Appleby tomorrow.’ ‘ What a coincidence ! I’m going there too.’
sentences.chinese: “明天我要去阿普尔比。”“太巧了！我也要去那里。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 巧合， 巧事； 一致， 符合

sentences.english: More than a third of all pedestrian injuries are to children.
sentences.chinese: 所有受伤的行人中有1/3以上是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is walking, especially along a street or other place used by cars

sentences.chinese: 8月29日皇家军队开进因弗内斯。

sentences.english: The police decided not to ban the march.
sentences.chinese: 警方决定不禁止这次示威游行。

detailed_translations.english: if soldiers or other people march somewhere, they walk there quickly with firm regular steps
an organized event in which many people walk together to express their ideas or protest about something

sentences.english: A small group of journalists waited on the pavement outside her house.
sentences.chinese: 有一小群记者守候在她家外面的人行道上。

sentences.english: a pavement cafe
sentences.chinese: 路边咖啡馆

detailed_translations.english: a hard level surface or path at the side of a road for people to walk on

sentences.english: The two soldiers saluted Lieutenant Cecil.
sentences.chinese: 那两名士兵向塞西尔中尉行了礼。

sentences.english: The men jumped to their feet and saluted.
sentences.chinese: 这些人赶紧起立敬礼。

detailed_translations.english: to move your right hand to your head, especially in order to show respect to an officer in the army, navy etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 向…敬礼，向…致意；赞扬，颂扬
detailed_translations.english: to move your right hand to your head, especially in order to show respect to an officer in the army, navy etc
an act of raising your right hand to your head as a sign of respect, usually done by a soldier to an officer

sentences.english: several cases of child abuse
sentences.chinese: 数宗虐待儿童案

sentences.english: An independent committee will look into alleged human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 一个独立委员会将对涉嫌践踏人权的行为进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: cruel or violent treatment of someone
to deliberately use something for the wrong purpose or for your own advantage

sentences.english: The last decade has witnessed a serious rise in the levels of racism and hostility to black and ethnic groups.
sentences.chinese: 过去的10年里，种族主义及对黑人和少数民族的敌意变得更加严重了。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is unfriendly and full of anger towards another person

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

sentences.english: Our thoughts and prayers are with you at this difficult time.
sentences.chinese: 在这艰难时期我们时刻思念你，为你祈祷。

sentences.english: The children said their prayers and got into bed.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们做完祷告后上床睡觉了。

sentences.english: God has answered your prayer .
sentences.chinese: 上帝应许了你的祷告。

sentences.english: the power of prayer
sentences.chinese: 祈祷的力量

detailed_translations.english: words that you say when praying to God or gods

sentences.english: The bomb went off at 9.30 in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹在早上9点半爆炸。

sentences.english: Enemy planes dropped over 200 bombs during the raid.
sentences.chinese: 袭击中敌机投下了两百多枚炸弹。

sentences.english: He was killed in a bomb explosion.
sentences.chinese: 他在一次炸弹爆炸中身亡。

sentences.english: The town was heavily bombed in World War II.
sentences.chinese: 这座城镇在第二次世界大战中遭到猛烈轰炸。

detailed_translations.english: a weapon made of material that will explode
to attack a place by leaving a bomb there, or by dropping bombs on it from a plane

sentences.english: the Supreme Allied Commander in Europe
sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟军最高指挥官

sentences.english: a country where the car reigns supreme
sentences.chinese: 汽车占绝对优势地位的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高的；至高的；最重要的
detailed_translations.english: having the highest position of power, importance, or influence

sentences.english: a nationwide search for a missing British tourist
sentences.chinese: 在全国范围内对一名失踪英国游客的搜寻

sentences.english: nationwide television
sentences.chinese: 全国性的电视节目

sentences.english: The figures show unemployment falling nationwide last month.
sentences.chinese: 数字显示，上个月失业数字正全国性地下降。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing in every part of the country

sentences.english: The right to speak freely is written into the Constitution of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 言论自由的权利被写入美国宪法。

sentences.english: She’s got a strong constitution – she’ll recover in no time.
sentences.chinese: 她体质强壮，很快就会恢复。

sentences.english: What’s the chemical constitution of the dye?
sentences.chinese: 这种染料的化学成分是什么？

detailed_translations.english: a set of basic laws and principles that a country or organization is governed by

sentences.english: a constitutional crisis
sentences.chinese: 宪法危机

detailed_translations.chinese: 宪法的；本质的；体质上的；保健的
detailed_translations.english: connected with the constitution of a country or organization
a walk you take because it is good for your health

sentences.english: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

sentences.english: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

sentences.english: the Battle of Trafalgar
sentences.chinese: 特拉法尔加战役

sentences.english: a pitched battle (=  a long and serious battle  ) between police and drug gangs
sentences.chinese: 警方和贩毒团伙之间的一场激战

detailed_translations.english: a fight between opposing armies, groups of ships, groups of people etc, especially one that is part of a larger war

sentences.chinese: 我们对面的那个建筑是仓库。

sentences.chinese: 每个仓库把它能完成客户定单的哪个部分（如果有）的报告返回给零售商。

sentences.english: This option allows organizations to pay only for the volume of compressed user data they manage in their warehouse.
sentences.chinese: 该定价方式允许组织只为他们在其仓库中管理的压缩的用户数据量进行付费。

detailed_translations.english: a large building for storing large quantities of goods

sentences.english: I’ve kept my side of the bargain and I expect you to keep yours.
sentences.chinese: 我履行了我的承诺，希望你也履行你的承诺。

sentences.english: women bargaining with traders
sentences.chinese: 和商贩讨价还价的女人

detailed_translations.english: an agreement, made between two people or groups to do something in return for something else
to discuss the conditions of a sale, agreement etc, for example to try and get a lower price

sentences.english: Burglars broke into their home.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼闯进了他们家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who goes into houses, shops etc to steal things

sentences.english: Be careful to perform the actions in the correct sequence.
sentences.chinese: 注意要按正确的顺序来完成动作。

detailed_translations.english: the order that something happens or exists in, or the order it is supposed to happen or exist in

sentences.english: I got out of the car to inspect the damage.
sentences.chinese: 我下车查看损坏情况。

sentences.english: Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
sentences.chinese: 警察仔细检查了现场并询问了所有员工。

sentences.english: General Allenby arrived to inspect the troops.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦比将军前来检阅部队。

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to find out more about it or to find out what is wrong with it

sentences.english: I remember changing cars twice when visiting her bungalow in New Delhi in 1998.
sentences.chinese: 我记得1998年去她在新德里的小平房拜访时，中途两次换车。

sentences.english: Belinda and Clive, who worked on the railways, moved to a bungalow not far from Barry Island.
sentences.chinese: 贝琳达和克里夫在铁路工作，并且搬到离巴厘岛不远的一处平房居住。

sentences.english: It would never have happened if he had stayed in Australia, for Australia is still the land of the bungalow.
sentences.chinese: 要是他居住在澳大利亚的话这种情况绝对不可能发生，因为现在澳大利亚土地上所座落的依然是平房。

detailed_translations.english: a house that is all on ground level

sentences.english: ...a large supermarket chain.
sentences.chinese: …一家大型连锁超市。

detailed_translations.english: a number of shops, hotels, cinemas etc owned or managed by the same company or person

sentences.english: A gold bracelet dangled from his left wrist.
sentences.chinese: 一只金手镯在他左腕上晃来晃去。

detailed_translations.english: If something dangles from somewhere or if you dangle it somewhere, it hangs or swings loosely

sentences.english: They sit cross-legged in a semicircle and share stories.
sentences.chinese: 他们盘着腿围成半圆坐在一起讲故事。

detailed_translations.english: half a circle

sentences.english: With a third group, she activated the squeak as if by accident.
sentences.chinese: 对于第三组，她则假装吱吱声是偶然发生的。

sentences.english: With a third group, she activated the squeak as if by accident.
sentences.chinese: 对于第三组孩子，她展示发出吱吱声好像意外发出一样。

sentences.english: She interrupted herself after demonstrating the squeak by saying she had to go and write something down, thus suggesting that she might not have finished the demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 当演示完吱吱声后，她停了下来，说自己有事得走了，并在纸上写下了些东西，以此暗示也许她还没完成整个过程。

detailed_translations.english: a very short high noise or cry
to make a short high noise or cry that is not loud

sentences.english: They finally found the cat up on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 他们最后在屋顶上找到了那只猫。

sentences.english: a flat roof
sentences.chinese: 平顶

sentences.english: a pitched roof
sentences.chinese: 斜顶

detailed_translations.chinese: 屋顶；最高处，顶部；最高限度
detailed_translations.english: the structure that covers or forms the top of a building, vehicle, tent etc
to put a roof on a building

sentences.english: He grabbed me by the collar.
sentences.chinese: 他抓住我的衣领。

sentences.english: He loosened his collar and tie .
sentences.chinese: 他松开了领子和领带。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a shirt, coat etc that fits around your neck, and is usually folded over

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓住；给…上领子；给…套上颈圈
detailed_translations.english: to catch someone and hold them so that they cannot escape

sentences.english: We sat on a park bench.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在公园的长椅上。

detailed_translations.english: a long seat for two or more people, especially outdoors

sentences.english: I pine for the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 我渴望乡下的生活。

detailed_translations.english: If you pine for something, you want it very much, especially when it is unlikely that you will be able to have it
a tall tree with long hard sharp leaves that do not fall off in winter

sentences.english: The cat dug his claws into my leg.
sentences.chinese: 猫的爪子抓进了我的腿中。

sentences.english: lobster claws
sentences.chinese: 龙虾的螯

detailed_translations.english: a sharp curved nail on an animal, bird, or some insects
to tear or pull at something, using claws or your fingers

sentences.english: The squirrel makes a store of nuts for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 松鼠贮藏坚果以备过冬。

sentences.english: The squirrel has laid in a store of nuts for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 松鼠已经贮存了许多坚果以备过冬。

sentences.english: It was moving fast like a squirrel, but it was as loud as a bear.
sentences.chinese: 它像松鼠一样快速的移动但那声音却像是熊发出的似的。

detailed_translations.english: a small animal with a long furry tail that climbs trees and eats nuts

sentences.english: Michelle married him after a whirlwind romance (= one that happens very suddenly and quickly ) .
sentences.chinese: 经过一场旋风式的恋爱，米歇尔嫁给了他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 传奇；浪漫史；风流韵事；冒险故事
detailed_translations.english: an exciting and often short relationship between two people who love each other
to describe things that have happened in a way that makes them seem more important, interesting etc than they really were

sentences.english: Police searched in vain for the missing gunman.
sentences.chinese: 警方搜寻失踪的持枪歹徒，但毫无结果。

sentences.english: Men can be just as vain as women.
sentences.chinese: 男人有时会和女人一样虚荣。

detailed_translations.english: without success in spite of your efforts

sentences.english: Have ye suffered so many things in vain? if it be yet in vain.
sentences.chinese: 你们受苦如此之多，都是徒然的吗。难道果真是徒然的吗。

sentences.english: Have ye suffered so many things in vain?
sentences.chinese: 你们受苦如此之多，都是徒然的吗。

sentences.english: He pressed the red alarm signal to see if it was on or off.
sentences.chinese: 他按了一下红色报警信号钮，检查一下它是开著的还是关著的。

detailed_translations.english: important
a sound or action that you make in order to give information to someone or tell them to do something
to make a sound or action in order to give information or tell someone to do something

sentences.english: They are often available at a discount.
sentences.chinese: 它们经常可以以折扣价买到。

sentences.english: This has forced airlines to discount fares heavily in order to spur demand.
sentences.chinese: 这已经迫使多家航空公司对机票大幅打折以刺激需求。

detailed_translations.english: a reduction in the usual price of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 将…打折扣； 不信； 漠视， 低估
detailed_translations.english: If a shop or company discounts an amount or percentage from something that they are selling, they take the amount or percentage off the usual price

sentences.english: a very sensitive child
sentences.chinese: 一个很敏感的小孩

sentences.english: a highly sensitive electronic camera
sentences.chinese: 高敏感度的电子摄像机

detailed_translations.english: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

sentences.english: He was unbearably arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 他的傲慢让人无法忍受。

sentences.english: an arrogant attitude
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的态度

detailed_translations.english: behaving in an unpleasant or rude way because you think you are more important than other people

sentences.english: We have already discussed this matter at great length.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经十分详尽地讨论了这个问题。

sentences.english: ‘I'm still not sure, ’ he said at length.
sentences.chinese: “我还是没把握。”他最后说道。

detailed_translations.english: for a long time and in detail

sentences.english: I am writing to confirm /enquire/inform you…
sentences.chinese: 我写信是要确认/询问/通知你…

sentences.english: I recently e-mailed one website to enquire why my goods had not yet arrived.
sentences.chinese: 我最近给一个网站发邮件去询问为什么我订购的商品还没有到达。

sentences.english: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, enquire who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go thence.
sentences.chinese: 你们无论进那一城，那一村，要打听那里谁是好人，就住在他家，直住到走的时候。

sentences.english: Don't think ill of the dead.
sentences.chinese: 对死去的人，别说他的短处。

detailed_translations.english: to say or think bad things about sb

name: do everything in one's power to

sentences.english: Today you may rejoice because of contacts, news or visits from friends who live in another city or country.
sentences.chinese: 今天您可能因为得到来自另一个城市或国家的朋友的联系、消息或拜访而感到高兴。

sentences.english: Why is it that we rejoice at a birth and grieve at a funeral? Is it because we are not the person concerned?
sentences.chinese: 我们为何在（人家）出生之时高兴而在殡殓之时又悲伤呢？是否因为我们不属于关人士才这样的？

sentences.english: an initial investment of £5,000
sentences.chinese: 5,000英镑的初始投资

sentences.english: The initial response has been encouraging.
sentences.chinese: 最初的反应情况很乐观。

detailed_translations.english: happening at the beginning
the first letter of someone’s first name

sentences.english: I’m really sorry - it’s all my fault.
sentences.chinese: 我真的很抱歉——都是我的错。

sentences.english: I didn’t sleep well that night, but it was my own fault .
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我没有睡好，但这是我自己的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad that has happened is your fault, you should be blamed for it, because you made a mistake or failed to do something

sentences.english: He soon regretted his hasty decision.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就对自己仓促作出的决定感到后悔了。

sentences.english: a hasty breakfast
sentences.chinese: 匆忙吃下的一顿早餐

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的；匆忙的；草率的；懈怠的
detailed_translations.english: done in a hurry, especially with bad results

sentences.english: a hastily arranged news conference
sentences.chinese: 仓促安排的记者招待会

detailed_translations.english: quickly, perhaps too quickly

sentences.english: She seems very sensible.
sentences.chinese: 她好像很明智。

sentences.english: sensible advice
sentences.chinese: 合理的建议

sentences.english: It’s sensible to keep a note of your passport number.
sentences.chinese: 把你的护照号码记下来是明智的。

sentences.english: Moving house seemed like the sensible thing to do .
sentences.chinese: 搬家似乎是明智的做法。

detailed_translations.english: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment
